edu.ucsb.cs56.pconrad.parsing.tokenizer

Interface TokenizerState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InitialTokenizerState, IntTokenizerState

    public interface TokenizerState
    Interface which states in the tokenizer must implement. This is per the usual definition of the State pattern.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Token> atInputEnd()
      Indicates that there are no more characters in the input.
      TokenizerStateResult nextState(char curChar)
      Given that the current character in the input is curChar, enter the next state, possibly producing tokens along the way.

    • Method Detail

      • nextState

        TokenizerStateResult nextState(char curChar)
                               throws TokenizerException
        Given that the current character in the input is curChar, enter the next state, possibly producing tokens along the way.
        Parameters:
        curChar - The current character we observe
        Returns:
        A result encapsulating the next state along with any tokens produced during the state transition
        Throws:
        TokenizerException - If tokenization failed for whatever reason, as with encountering an unexpected character

      • atInputEnd

        List<Token> atInputEnd()
                       throws TokenizerException
        Indicates that there are no more characters in the input. This is necessary in the case when the input ends with an integer like 123; we can't produce the integer until we see all the digits, but if the input ends on 3, then there are no further digits to feed into nextState. As such, this method is called to actually create the integer token holding the decimal value 123.
        Returns:
        A possibly empty list of tokens produced by indicating we are at the end of the input
        Throws:
        TokenizerException - If tokenization failed for whatever reason
